intro: Oxypetalum teyucuarense, commonly known as the Teyucuarense oxypetalum, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
